name: StreetType
title: Street Type
description: Street Type codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A street associated with or named after an abbey or monastery.
A residential development or street name referencing land measurement.
A tree-lined walkway or narrow passageway.
A narrow passageway between or behind buildings.
A wide street or thoroughfare (French designation).
A wide street or thoroughfare (English designation).
A street in a curved or recessed configuration.
A street adjacent to or associated with a waterfront.
A wide, multi-lane street often with a median (English designation).
A wide, multi-lane street often with a median (French designation).
A road that routes traffic around a congested area.
A central location or hub (French designation).
A street within or associated with an institutional grounds.
A street associated with a geographical cape or headland.
A dead-end street with a circular turnaround.
A road or path, often rural.
A circular or curved street configuration.
A looping street that returns to its starting point.
A short, enclosed street or cul-de-sac.
A public open space or shared area.
A rural road following original land survey lines.
A small sheltered street or bay-shaped configuration.
A street at an intersection or corner location.
A pedestrian or vehicular crossing point.
A short street or enclosed residential area.
A central location or hub (English designation).
An open elevated area or hillside.
The terminus or conclusion of a street.
A level open space or waterfront promenade.
A residential development or property subdivision.
A continuation of an existing street.
A roadway associated with agricultural property.
A wooded area or tree-lined street.
A street facing the main facade of properties.
An entry point or gated access road.
A landscaped area or residential development.
An open space within wooded area.
A narrow valley or secluded area.
A grassy common area or park.
An area of land surrounding a building or estate.
A small group of trees or wooded area.
A waterfront area or marina access.
A narrow water passage or recess.
A place where boats dock or a stairway platform.
A rural road following property lines.
A connecting roadway between two streets.
A pedestrian shopping area or promenade.
A residential estate or large property.
A grassland or open field area.
A row of houses converted from stables.
A fruit tree plantation or grove.
A public park or green space.
A landscaped roadway with recreational access.
A short street or open square (English designation).
A public square or plaza (French designation).
A public walkway, especially along a waterfront.
An inclined roadway for access or egress.
A rural road in Quebec's seigneurial system.
A series of mountains or rural road designation.
A line of houses or buildings.
An open public space or plaza.
A public roadway in an urban area.
A raised level platform or row of houses.
A dense growth of shrubs or small trees.
A tall residential or commercial building.
A raised platform or terrace (French designation).
A valley or low area between hills.
A scenic lookout or vista point.
A structure for loading and unloading ships.
An entry point or approach road.
A land measurement designation in street names.
A bay or curved waterfront area.
A city block or section of buildings.
A structure spanning a waterway or gap.
A small enclosed field or farm.
An intersection of two or more roads.
A service road or access route.
A private vehicle access to a property.
A safe harbor or sheltered area.
A narrow roadway or service lane.
A mountain summit or highest point.
A straight section of waterway or road.
A secondary road branching from a main road.
The highest point of a mountain or hill.
